results.definition: inhabit or live in; be an inhabitant of
examples: People lived in Africa millions of years ago
The people inhabited the islands that are now deserted
this kind of fish dwells near the bottom of the ocean
deer are populating the woods

results.definition: lead a certain kind of life; live in a certain style
examples: we had to live frugally after the war

results.definition: continue to live through hardship or adversity
examples: We went without water and food for 3 days
These superstitions survive in the backwaters of America
The race car driver lived through several very serious accidents
how long can a person last without food and water?
he could barely exist on such a low wage
Can you live on $2000 a month in New York City?
Many people in the world have to subsist on $1 a day
Our great leader is no more
My grandfather lived until the end of war

results.definition: have firsthand knowledge of states, situations, emotions, or sensations
examples: I know the feeling!
have you ever known hunger?
I have lived a kind of hell when I was a drug addict
The holocaust survivors have lived a nightmare
I lived through two divorces

results.definition: pursue a positive and satisfying existence
examples: You must accept yourself and others if you really want to live
